article.headline: Davidson 62, Samford 49
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. -- JP Kuhlman scored 15 points to lead Davidson to a 62-49 victory over Samford on Thursday night. Brendan McKillop added 12 points, on four 3-pointers, and the Wildcats (11-12, 5-7 Southern Conference) improved to 3-8 on the road this year. Davidson was 12 of 25 from the 3-point line (48 percent), including 8 of 15 in the first half (53.3 percent), to help the Wildcats build a 33-24 halftime lead. Samford (11-12, 3-8), which has lost seven of eight games, shot only 11.8 percent from beyond the arc (2 of 17), including 0 for 8 in the second half. The Wildcats led by at least nine throughout the second half, pushing the margin to 21 on De'Mon Brooks' two free throws with 8:23 left. Davidson outrebounded Samford 44-25, leading to 12 second-chance points. Brooks finished with 11 points. Josh Davis and Gregg Wooten had 10 points each for Samford.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
